topic.title: Cannot connect to any peer(Guessing China has blocked peer server)
topic.body: ### Step 1: Please describe your environment * ZeroNet version: 0.6.2 * Operating system: Ubuntu 17.10 * Web browser: Chromium * Tor status: not available * Opened port: no * Special configuration: no ### Step 2: Describe the problem: I newly installed ZeroNet Bundle, When Loading ZeroHello, No peer was found and content.json download failed. #### Steps to reproduce: 1. Install Zeronet Bundle following github tutorial 2. Start ./ZeroNet.sh #### Observed Results: #### Expected Results: * What did you expect to happen? I am located in China. I guess China has blocked Zeronet's peer server after a massive VPN bans and zeronet.io ban, because zeronet is becoming more and more popular in China.

topic.title: Why my issue be deleted?
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: 0.6.2
  * Operating system: Ubuntu 17.10
  * Web browser: Chromium
  * Tor status: not available
  * Opened port: no
  * Special configuration: no

### Step 2: Describe the problem:

I newly installed ZeroNet Bundle, When Loading ZeroHello, No peer was found and content.json download failed.

#### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Install Zeronet Bundle following github tutorial
  2. Start ./ZeroNet.sh
#### Observed Results:


#### Expected Results:

  * What did you expect to happen?
I am located in China.
I guess China has blocked Zeronet's peer server after a massive VPN bans and zeronet.io ban, because zeronet is becoming more and more popular in China.

1604066466_mirrored_catalystsitaly_githu.body: @HelloZeroNet Thank you very much for your response. Sorry this is my first time to open an issue on github so I don't know you have already closed it. Thanks for your great project!
